channel.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
channel.description:
[poll type=regular public=true] * Agree * Disagree (and say why below) [/poll]
Prince should also be vulnerable to regular occupy
[poll name=poll2 type=regular public=true] * Agree * Disagree [/poll]

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: Sharvax
item.description:
If you can hh a mastermind, Prince exe should be interruptable. You are still jailing them for a night, just can’t exe. (Imho) yeah I know it’s late lol

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
No. It doesn’t. All it does is make you not be lynched by those doing whisper meta who are only trying not to be lynched by those doing whisper meta who are only…

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

The prince should be strong as they are meant to be the Blue Dragon’s leader(and look at Mastermind and Cult Leader. They’re both strong leaders, though they still have counterplay), but I agree that that does not mean that prince should not have counterplay.

Leader is a surprisingly vague term. Yes he should be strong and yes he should try and gather information and coordinate BD as much as possible. His ability’s do allow for this (but not as well as mystics do) and that is 100% a good way to play. It just isn’t his primary effect on the game

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Also whisper meta only makes you think you win more games

Discuss

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Jail and execute. Both are individually threats that evils would want to prioritize removing.

Giving BD something to hide means that revealing information is riskier and that someone who isn’t claiming might be overlooked making the dynamic important. This distrust he causes is counter balanced by his inherent power.

This is why when Prince dies N1 the BD are only disadvantaged instead of utterly fucked (compare MM)

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
The prince should be strong as they are meant to be the Blue Dragon’s leader(and look at Mastermind and Cult Leader. They’re both strong leaders, though they still have counterplay), but I agree that that does not mean that prince should not have counterplay.

NuclearBurrito:

Instead, his job is to be a big target which BD wants to hide and Unseen/Cult want to find really badly.

Firelitten:

but then why is he here

The prince is(or at least should) be meant as the Blue Dragon’s leader. They should help coordinate the BD and gather information. The Cult and Unseen each have a leader class so why shouldn’t the Blue Dragon.

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

TBH. The point of Prince isn’t to be really strong. Instead, his job is to be a big target which BD wants to hide and Unseen/Cult want to find really badly. Giving Unseen/Cult more ways to deal with a known Prince is thus a good thing

^^^

Read full topic

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
Surprised to see so many players want to keep occupy immunity for the Prince

There’s literally no reason the Prince should have it, and it would open up a lot of new gameplay that didn’t exist before.

item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
RHCube:

the main reason why happy hour needs reworking is because it’s a better version of serve wine, the only advantage Butler has is unlimited uses

The advantage the Butler has is also an absolute defence, which is more important for the BD, as the Butler can maintain a large presence in the court. Butlers can also kill kings, which is pretty strong as well.

Read full topic
item.source: Prince should be vulnerable to HH

item.title: Prince should be vulnerable to HH
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Maybe it could work like this instead then:

Happy hour(uses: unlimited)- remove your targets immunities and disable their passives until the end of the next night.

the main reason why happy hour needs reworking is because it’s a better version of serve wine, the only advantage Butler has is unlimited uses
